casebody.data:
John M. White, appellant, v. The Iron Steam Boat Co., respondent. Decided February 2, 1885.

Before Van Vorst and Freedman, JJ.

Per Curiam.

The reasons assigned' by Sedgwick, Ch. J., who presided at the trial, justify the order made by him, granting a new trial. Upon an examination of the case, and a consideration of the points submitted on this appeal, we are led to the same conclusion as that reached by the learned trial judge. Order affirmed, with costs and disbursements.
